title: Potential energy - particles in triangular pyramid

content.description: Two particles of a certain type interact with each other with a repulsive conservative force with magnitude <math alttext="F equals the fraction alpha over r cubed, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>F</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mi>α</mi><msup><mi>r</mi><mn>3</mn></msup></mfrac></math> where <math alttext="alpha" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>α</mi></math> is a constant and <math alttext="r" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>r</mi></math> is the distance between the particles. A system of four such particles is held together to form a triangular pyramid with a distance <math alttext="d" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>d</mi></math> between each pair of particles, as shown in the figure.
content.question: If the potential energy associated with <math alttext="F" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>F</mi></math> is defined to be zero at infinite separation, what is the potential energy of the four-particle system while it is being held in the triangular pyramid arrangement shown?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction 2 alpha, over d squared, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>α</mi></mrow><msup><mi>d</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac></math>
<math alttext="the fraction 3 alpha, over d squared, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>α</mi></mrow><msup><mi>d</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac></math>
<math alttext="the fraction 6 alpha, over d cubed, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><mn>6</mn><mi>α</mi></mrow><msup><mi>d</mi><mn>3</mn></msup></mfrac></math>

<math alttext="the fraction negative 18 alpha, over d to the fourth power, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>18</mn><mi>α</mi></mrow><msup><mi>d</mi><mn>4</mn></msup></mfrac></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction 3 alpha, over d squared, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>α</mi></mrow><msup><mi>d</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac></math>
